content:
This is a dangerous activity with an Item Retrieval Service (IRS).
On death, all unprotected items will be transferred to the IRS near the activity's entrance. Dying a second unsafe death will permanently delete all items left in the IRS. All items left on the ground will be lost, and Hardcore Ironmen will lose their status.
This article has a strategy guide here.
All information on mechanics and strategy will be on this page.

Theatre of Blood
Also called Raids 2, ToB
Released 7 June 2018 (Update)
Type Raid
Members Yes

Reward currency None
Tutorial No
Music See below
Location

The Theatre of Blood is a large arena located beneath the castle of Ver Sinhaza. It is used by the ruling vampyres to host blood sports. Here, the citizens of Meiyerditch are encouraged to go to the theatre and fight against the various experiments and abominations contained within, with the promise of freedom from the blood tithes and the right to leave Morytania should they succeed. The reward is revealed to be a ruse as the vampyres are unwilling to let go of their primary food source.

While the theatre is only open to citizens of Meiyerditch, this rule is rarely enforced. The vampyres are more entertained by outsiders than the citizens themselves, seeing as these are better prepared compared to the civilians who are inexperienced and poorly equipped.

Bosses[edit | edit source]

A group of players battle against Sotetseg, a dark beast corrupted through Haemalchemy and experiments in the Shadow Realm.
Wave complete
The jingle that plays once a boss has been defeated.

The Theatre of Blood is a linear raid. Thus, there is no randomization involved, and the bosses will always be encountered in this order.

  1. The Maiden of Sugadinti (level-940)
  2. Pestilent Bloat (level-870)
  3. Nylocas Vasilias (level-800)
  4. Sotetseg (level-995)
  5. Xarpus (level-960)
  6. Verzik Vitur (level-1040, final boss)

Despite some of the bosses being spiders, vampyres and dark beasts, they will not count towards a Slayer task when killed inside the Theatre; thus, the slayer helmet and black mask bonuses have no effect.

The bosses will also have their hitpoints scaled depending on the team size. With a team of three or fewer players the bosses will have 75% of their original hitpoints, with four players the bosses will have 87.5% of their original hitpoints and a team of five players will leave the bosses' hitpoints unchanged.

Death within the Theatre[edit | edit source]

If players die within the theatre, they are placed outside the fighting area, and can only proceed if other team members succeed in completing the current challenge. If the entire team is killed, players will lose all unprotected items; these can later be reclaimed from a storage chest (similar to Torfinn's item storage) for a cost of 100,000 coins. Untradeable items that are normally kept on death will be placed in the item reclamation chest upon complete team death in the theatre.

If players die a second time without reclaiming the items in the chest, they will be permanently lost, unless the death occurs within a minigame deemed safe, such as Pest Control.

Dying in the Theatre of Blood is a dangerous death - Hardcore Ironmen who die within the theatre will lose their Hardcore status, regardless of whether the team successfully completes the challenges or not. Any disconnection or logout during a fight is treated as a death, and will likewise result in loss of Hardcore status. Should a player logout when not in an encounter, such as in the hallways of the theatre, the player's death will be treated as a safe death. Upon logging back in to an unsafe death, the game will attempt to reunite the player with their party and, if successful, will place the player in purgatory. If unsuccessful, the player will be treated with a full death and will have to pay the item reclamation fee to retrieve any items lost.

All normal forms of teleportation within the Theatre are blocked; however, the Mysterious Stranger outside sells escape crystals for 75,000 coins each, and is the only item players can use to teleport away from the Theatre safely.

Spectating[edit | edit source]

Players can spectate other teams in the Theatre of Blood by attempting to enter the theatre, or by speaking to Abigaila, a Morytanian refugee who can be found upstairs in the Lumbridge General Store or near the spirit tree north-east of the Grand Exchange.

Players can either choose to spectate a specific player's team by typing in a team member's or a spectator's name, or choose to spectate the most recently formed party. Spectators must be on the same world as the party member or spectator they wish to spectate. Spectators must also be on the Friends List of the party member or spectator, should the party member or spectator have Private Chat set to "Friends Only."

In order to spectate, players cannot bring any items with them, excluding the oculus orb, and they must not be poisoned or diseased.

As of an update on 21 June 2018, players can right-click the ledges to view the fight in a better perspective. Players can rotate the camera clock-wise or counter-clockwise via the chatbox.

Other modes[edit | edit source]

Entry Mode[edit | edit source]

Main article: Theatre of Blood/Entry Mode

An easy variant of the Theatre of Blood intended for beginners to warm themselves up and gain experience before attempting the Theatre in Normal Mode. Every enemy encountered is significantly weaker than their Normal Mode counterparts and the mechanics themselves are adjusted to be less fatal.

Unlike Normal Mode, there are three safe deaths in total, allowing the player to tackle the current encounter again in the event of death. If the player dies once more after these tries are used up, the death is considered a normal death and players must repay to reclaim their items. Hardcore Ironmen will lose their status if they die or disconnect at any of the bosses, akin to how the raid treats them in Normal and Hard Mode.

As a result of being easier than Normal Mode, raids completed in this manner give 85% less loot than Normal Mode, with no chance of obtaining any unique item, including the Lil' zik pet.

Hard Mode[edit | edit source]

Main article: Theatre of Blood/Hard Mode

A hard variant of the Theatre of Blood is also available for players up to the challenge. Similarly to the Chambers of Xeric "Challenge Mode", all enemies in the Theatre of Blood are significantly stronger, this time with new or modified mechanics in play. Completion of Hard Mode can yield Sanguine dust to reskin Lil' Zik, and the Holy and Sanguine ornament kits to recolour the sanguinesti staff, ghrazi rapier and scythe of vitur, with the latter kit only working for the scythe.

Teams are also awarded with 15% more common drops when received (with an additional 15% if the raid is completed within the challenge time), along with a 13% chance of obtaining unique items (compared to the standard 11%),[1] with the avernic defender hilt being less common in Hard Mode than Normal Mode in order to make the other uniques slightly more common.

In order to access Hard Mode, players must have completed the Theatre in Normal Mode at least once.

Rewards[edit | edit source]

Verzik Vitur's treasure vault.

Upon defeating Verzik Vitur, a trapdoor will open under her throne, leading to her treasure vault.

Inside will be up to five large chests based on the amount of players in the team, with each player being able to loot one chest. An arrow will point to which chest is for that player to search.

A monumental chest, with the arrow denoting the player's chest.

If a unique reward is obtained, a purple aura will emit from the chest, much like how the ray of light turns purple for the player who obtains a unique reward in the Chambers of Xeric. If no unique reward is found, players obtain up to three different common rewards instead depending on their performance.

Players can also search the grand bookshelves in the treasure vault to find six books:

  1. Serafina's Diary
  2. The Butcher
  3. Arachnids of Vampyrium
  4. The Shadow Realm
  5. The Wild Hunt
  6. Verzik Vitur - Patient Record

Loot table[edit | edit source]

Drop rates estimated based on 65,505 Theatre of Blood completions from the Drop Rate Project, unless otherwise cited.

The average Theatre of Blood deathless 4-player completion is worth 8,064,742.72.

All non-stackable items obtained are in the form of bank notes, unless it is a unique reward. If the player obtains a unique reward, it will replace all common rewards. If not, the common reward table is rolled three times, possibly granting the same reward multiple times.

To calculate the expected loot based on a player's specific scenario, please refer to the rewards calculator.

Pre-roll[edit | edit source]

Without any deaths, there is a 1/9.1 (~11%) chance of a unique reward across the team; dying will decrease this chance. The displayed drop chances below assume no deaths. The drop rate is the same regardless of the number of players completing the raid. The item is allocated to one player, with the weighting based on deaths and damage dealt to each boss. The MVP is the most likely to receive the item.[2]

For Hard Mode, the unique chance is increased to 1/7.7 (~13%), with the weighting for the avernic defender hilt reduced in order to make the other uniques more common.[3] Entry Mode does not grant pre-rolls for uniques.

Performance & records[edit | edit source]

Performance Details[edit | edit source]

Performance Details for a performance within the Theatre of Blood.

Upon entering the treasure vault, players may read the strategy table by the grand bookshelves to view the overall performance of the team, while spectators can read the war table to view it.

Here, players may view the death counts of each team member, the total deaths in the performance, as well as the time spent in each wave.

The Most Valuable Player (MVP) is listed on the top of the interface, and is determined based on the performance of the individual player, such as damage dealt and the number of deaths.

The challenge time (the time spent fighting the bosses) and the overall time, which includes the time spent between waves, can be seen on the bottom of the interface.

Scoreboard[edit | edit source]

The Theatre of Blood scoreboard found next to the entrance of the theatre.

Next to the entrance to the Theatre of Blood is a scoreboard, which displays personal and global statistics for the Theatre of Blood, such as number of attempts, number of completions, number of deaths, and completion times.

Theatre of Blood records[edit | edit source]

An official records page existed, which showed all-time global records, such as most completions by an individual and total Hardcore Ironman deaths within the theatre, as well as fastest completion times for each boss and the raid as a whole. The page has since been decommissioned.

  • Players can now use escape crystals on their party members to activate them, allowing teleportation of teammates out of the raid in an instant. To enable this, right-click a crystal and select 'Toggle'. Both players must have a crystal for this to work, and both crystals will be consumed in the process.
28 July 2021
(update)

The Story Mode version of the Theatre of Blood has been renamed to Entry Mode.

3 June 2021
(update | poll)

Story and hard modes added. Story mode provides an easier fight but less rewards and no chance of obtaining any unique, while hard mode provides a harder fight, but with a better chance of obtaining uniques and better common drops if completed in a specific time.

28 April 2021
(update)

The Theatre of Blood is now a safe zone on PvP worlds.

7 April 2021
(update | poll)

There's now a chest just opposite the bank booths, that allows one to obtain any loot they forgot to claim after defeating Verzik Vitur.

3 March 2021
(update)

The quota of daily party formations in the Theatre of Blood has increased.

18 June 2020
(update)

The death animation of Nylocas Athanatos and Matomenos has been reduced.

12 March 2020
(update)

If players are attempting to start a Theatre of Blood wave, but some of their party members are still in the previous wave's arena, the warning screen that appears will now make this more explicit.

2 May 2019
(update)
  • The Pestilent bloat within the Theatre of Blood should now fall down in the correct position.
  • One of the Nylocas walking toward the centre of the arena will no longer incorrectly change into a smaller Nylocas.
  • Verzik should now correctly move at the correct times during attack animations, to prevent her from appearing in the wrong location.
  • Xarpus' exhumed phase has been made shorter and scaled better for smaller team sizes. To keep it balanced, each absorption is now more powerful.
  • Odd pathing in Verzik's third phase caused by occasionally appearing to target a dead player has been fixed.
6 September 2018
(update)

Elite clue drop rate was changed, as it was previously 1/750.

21 June 2018
(update)
  • Bosses' Hitpoints now scale to four and three player teams.
  • Resource chests now use a point system instead of giving random supplies.
  • The Nylocas encounter was shortened by removing some earlier waves as they made the encounter needlessly long. The boss of the encounter was also buffed by making damage dealt with the incorrect style reflect and heal 100% instead of 50%, as well as increasing its Hitpoints and damage dealt.
  • Other minor tweaks were made regarding balance and QoL.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The Theatre of Blood was first mentioned in game in the book The Tale of Serafina, found in the Myths' Guild Library.
  • The names for many of the monsters in the raid mostly come from Eastern and Southeastern European words:

  • The release date for the Theatre of Blood was silently announced in an update on 3 May 2018 via a leaflet just north of the Ectofuntus, which displayed the following message when read:

The greatest collection of powerful beasts are here for your entertainment.

Tickets available from June 7th!

”

  • Upon the release of the Theatre of Blood, there was a bug which would cause players to drop the item in the top right corner of their inventory on the floor upon death, if they were in possession of Dawnbringer. This bug was hotfixed within one hour of discovery.

[[File:Theatre of Blood logo.png|left|120px]]
The '''Theatre of Blood''' is a large arena located beneath the castle of [[Ver Sinhaza]]. It is used by the ruling [[vampyre]]s to host blood sports. Here, the citizens of [[Meiyerditch]] are encouraged to go to the theatre and fight against the various experiments and abominations contained within, with the promise of freedom from the [[blood tithe]]s and the right to leave [[Morytania]] should they succeed. The reward is revealed to be a ruse as the vampyres are unwilling to let go of their primary food source.

While the theatre is only open to citizens of [[Meiyerditch]], this rule is rarely enforced. The vampyres are more entertained by outsiders than the citizens themselves, seeing as these are better prepared compared to the civilians who are inexperienced and poorly equipped.

==Bosses==
<choose>
<option>[[File:Fighting The Maiden of Sugadinti.png|thumb|300px|A group of players fighting Serafina, the Maiden of Sugadinti.]]</option>
<option>[[File:Fighting Pestilent Bloat.png|thumb|300px|A group of players fighting The Butcher's crazed creation, the Pestilent Bloat.]]</option>
<option>[[File:Fighting Nylocas Vasilias.png|thumb|300px|A group of players fighting the Nylocas Vasilias, a result of Verzik Vitur's diverse breeding program.]]</option>
<option>[[File:Fighting Sotetseg.png|thumb|300px|A group of players battle against Sotetseg, a [[dark beast]] corrupted through [[Haemalchemy]] and experiments in the [[Shadow Realm]].]]</option>
<option>[[File:Fighting Xarpus.png|thumb|300px|A group of players fighting Xarpus, the last of the Yarasa race and its king.]]</option>
<option>[[File:Fighting Verzik Vitur.png|thumb|300px|A group of players fighting Verzik Vitur, a powerful [[vampyre]] noble.]]</option>
</choose>
{{Listen
|title = Wave complete
|align = right
|filename = Theatre of Blood - wave complete.ogg
|desc = The jingle that plays once a boss has been defeated.}}
The Theatre of Blood is a linear raid. Thus, there is no randomization involved, and the bosses will always be encountered in this order.
#[[The Maiden of Sugadinti]] (level-940)
#[[Pestilent Bloat]] (level-870)
#[[Nylocas Vasilias]] (level-800)
#[[Sotetseg]] (level-995)
#[[Xarpus]] (level-960)
#[[Verzik Vitur]] (level-1040, final boss)

Despite some of the bosses being spiders, vampyres and dark beasts, they '''will not''' count towards a [[Slayer task]] when killed inside the Theatre; thus, the [[slayer helmet]] and [[black mask]] bonuses have no effect.

The bosses will also have their hitpoints scaled depending on the team size. With a team of three or fewer players the bosses will have 75% of their original hitpoints, with four players the bosses will have 87.5% of their original hitpoints and a team of five players will leave the bosses' hitpoints unchanged.

==Death within the Theatre==
If players die within the theatre, they are placed outside the fighting area, and can only proceed if other team members succeed in completing the current challenge. If the entire team is killed, players will lose all unprotected items; these can later be reclaimed from a storage chest (similar to [[Torfinn]]'s item storage) for a cost of 100,000 coins. Untradeable items that are normally kept on death will be placed in the item reclamation chest upon complete team death in the theatre.

If players die a second time without reclaiming the items in the chest, they will be permanently lost, unless the death occurs within a minigame deemed safe, such as [[Pest Control]].

Dying in the Theatre of Blood is a dangerous death - [[Ironman mode#Hardcore|Hardcore Ironmen]] who die within the theatre will lose their Hardcore status, regardless of whether the team successfully completes the challenges or not. Any disconnection or logout during a fight is treated as a death, and will likewise result in loss of Hardcore status. Should a player logout when not in an encounter, such as in the hallways of the theatre, the player's death will be treated as a safe death. Upon logging back in to an unsafe death, the game will attempt to reunite the player with their party and, if successful, will place the player in purgatory. If unsuccessful, the player will be treated with a full death and will have to pay the item reclamation fee to retrieve any items lost.

All normal forms of teleportation within the Theatre are blocked; however, the [[Mysterious Stranger]] outside sells [[escape crystal]]s for 75,000 coins each, and is the only item players can use to teleport away from the Theatre safely.

==Spectating==
[[File:Abigaila chathead.png|left]]
Players can spectate other teams in the Theatre of Blood by attempting to enter the theatre, or by speaking to [[Abigaila]], a [[Morytania]]n refugee who can be found upstairs in the [[Lumbridge General Store]] or near the [[spirit tree]] north-east of the [[Grand Exchange]].

Players can either choose to spectate a specific player's team by typing in a team member's or a spectator's name, or choose to spectate the most recently formed party. Spectators must be on the same world as the party member or spectator they wish to spectate. Spectators must also be on the [[Friends List]] of the party member or spectator, should the party member or spectator have Private Chat set to "Friends Only."

In order to spectate, players cannot bring any items with them, excluding the [[oculus orb]], and they must not be [[poison]]ed or [[disease]]d.

As of [[Update:Theatre of Blood Changes & Deadman Summer Finals|an update]] on [[21 June]] [[2018]], players can right-click the ledges to view the fight in a better perspective. Players can rotate the camera clock-wise or counter-clockwise via the chatbox.

==Other modes==
===Entry Mode===
{{Main|Theatre of Blood/Entry Mode}}
An easy variant of the Theatre of Blood intended for beginners to warm themselves up and gain experience before attempting the Theatre in Normal Mode. Every enemy encountered is significantly weaker than their Normal Mode counterparts and the mechanics themselves are adjusted to be less fatal.

Unlike Normal Mode, there are three safe deaths in total, allowing the player to tackle the current encounter again in the event of death. If the player dies once more after these tries are used up, the death is considered a normal death and players must repay to reclaim their items. Hardcore Ironmen will lose their status if they die or disconnect at any of the bosses, akin to how the raid treats them in Normal and Hard Mode.

As a result of being easier than Normal Mode, raids completed in this manner give 85% less loot than Normal Mode, with no chance of obtaining any unique item, including the Lil' zik pet.

===Hard Mode===
{{Main|Theatre of Blood/Hard Mode}}
A hard variant of the Theatre of Blood is also available for players up to the challenge. Similarly to the Chambers of Xeric "Challenge Mode", all enemies in the Theatre of Blood are significantly stronger, this time with new or modified mechanics in play. Completion of Hard Mode can yield [[Sanguine dust]] to reskin [[Lil' Zik]], and the [[Holy ornament kit|Holy]] and [[Sanguine ornament kit]]s to recolour the [[sanguinesti staff]], [[ghrazi rapier]] and [[scythe of vitur]], with the latter kit only working for the scythe.

Teams are also awarded with 15% more common drops when received (with an additional 15% if the raid is completed within the challenge time), along with a 13% chance of obtaining unique items (compared to the standard 11%),{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Arcane|url=https://twitter.com/JagexArcane/status/1485992982906085376|date=25 Januaary 2022|archiveurl=https://archive.ph/VOZ7h|archivedate=25 January 2022|quote=}} with the [[avernic defender hilt]] being less common in Hard Mode than Normal Mode in order to make the other uniques slightly more common.

In order to access Hard Mode, players must have completed the Theatre in Normal Mode at least once.

==Rewards==
[[File:Verzik's treasure vault.png|thumb|250px|Verzik Vitur's treasure vault.]]
Upon defeating Verzik Vitur, a trapdoor will open under her throne, leading to her treasure vault.

Inside will be up to five large chests based on the amount of players in the team, with each player being able to loot one chest. An arrow will point to which chest is for that player to search.
[[File:Theatre of Blood monumental chest.gif|thumb|200px|A monumental chest, with the arrow denoting the player's chest.]]
If a unique reward is obtained, a purple aura will emit from the chest, much like how the ray of light turns purple for the player who obtains a unique reward in the [[Chambers of Xeric]]. If no unique reward is found, players obtain up to three different common rewards instead depending on their performance.

Players can also search the [[grand bookshelves]] in the treasure vault to find six books:

#{{plink|Serafina's diary|txt=Serafina's Diary}}
#{{plink|The butcher|txt=The Butcher}}
#{{plink|Arachnids of vampyrium|txt=Arachnids of Vampyrium}}
#{{plink|The shadow realm|txt=The Shadow Realm}}
#{{plink|The wild hunt|txt=The Wild Hunt}}
#{{plink|Verzik vitur - patient record|txt=Verzik Vitur - Patient Record}}

To calculate the expected loot based on a player's specific scenario, please refer to the [[Theatre of Blood#Rewards calculator|rewards calculator]].

The MVP is the most likely to receive the item.''{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Kieren|url=https://twitter.com/JagexKieren/status/1145376451446751232|date=30 June 2019|archiveurl=https://archive.ph/t2Wnz|archivedate=3 January 2020}}

==Performance & records==
===Performance Details===
[[File:Theatre of Blood - Performance Details.png|thumb|270px|Performance Details for a performance within the Theatre of Blood.]]
Upon entering the treasure vault, players may read the [[strategy table]] by the grand bookshelves to view the overall performance of the team, while spectators can read the [[war table]] to view it.

Here, players may view the death counts of each team member, the total deaths in the performance, as well as the time spent in each wave.

The Most Valuable Player (MVP) is listed on the top of the interface, and is determined based on the performance of the individual player, such as damage dealt and the number of deaths.

The challenge time (the time spent fighting the bosses) and the overall time, which includes the time spent between waves, can be seen on the bottom of the interface.

===Scoreboard===
[[File:Theatre of Blood scoreboard.png|thumb|250px|The Theatre of Blood scoreboard found next to the entrance of the theatre.]]
Next to the entrance to the Theatre of Blood is a scoreboard, which displays personal and global statistics for the Theatre of Blood, such as number of attempts, number of completions, number of deaths, and completion times.

===Theatre of Blood records===
An official [https://www.runescape.com/oldschool/TOB/records records page] existed, which showed all-time global records, such as most completions by an individual and total [[Ironman Mode#Hardcore|Hardcore Ironman]] deaths within the theatre, as well as fastest completion times for each boss and the raid as a whole. The page has since been decommissioned.

|update = Deadman Reborn and QoL Changes
|change = The party leader can now re-order their party at the notice board in Ver Sinhaza.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 4 August 2021
|update = New Client Features: Milestone 2
|poll = A Night At The Theatre and Old School Content Poll 75: PvM
|change = * A filter has been added to the Theatre of Blood Party Board to help players find their friends and Clanmates.
* Players can now use escape crystals on their party members to activate them, allowing teleportation of teammates out of the raid in an instant. To enable this, right-click a crystal and select 'Toggle'. Both players must have a crystal for this to work, and both crystals will be consumed in the process.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 28 July 2021
|update = A Night At The Theatre Rework
|change = The Story Mode version of the Theatre of Blood has been renamed to Entry Mode.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 3 June 2021
|update = Theatre of Blood: New Modes
|poll = A Night At The Theatre and Old School Content Poll 75: PvM
|change = Story and hard modes added. Story mode provides an easier fight but less rewards and no chance of obtaining any unique, while hard mode provides a harder fight, but with a better chance of obtaining uniques and better common drops if completed in a specific time.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 28 April 2021
|update = Arceuus Spellbook Beta and A Kingdom Divided Preparation
|change = The Theatre of Blood is now a safe zone on PvP worlds.
}}
{{Subject changes

|poll = Old School Content Poll 74: Collection Log & Game Improvements

|change = There's now a chest just opposite the bank booths, that allows one to obtain any loot they forgot to claim after defeating Verzik Vitur.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 3 March 2021
|update = TzHaar-Ket-Rak's Challenges
|change = The quota of daily party formations in the Theatre of Blood has increased.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 18 June 2020
|update = Poll 71 and Darkmeyer Updates
|poll =
|change = The death animation of Nylocas Athanatos and Matomenos has been reduced.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 12 March 2020
|update = Phosani's Nightmare and HiScores
|change = If players are attempting to start a Theatre of Blood wave, but some of their party members are still in the previous wave's arena, the warning screen that appears will now make this more explicit.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 2 May 2019
|update = Automated Plank Make and In Game Clock
|change =
*The Pestilent bloat within the Theatre of Blood should now fall down in the correct position.
*One of the Nylocas walking toward the centre of the arena will no longer incorrectly change into a smaller Nylocas.
*Verzik should now correctly move at the correct times during attack animations, to prevent her from appearing in the wrong location.
*Xarpus' exhumed phase has been made shorter and scaled better for smaller team sizes. To keep it balanced, each absorption is now more powerful.
*Odd pathing in Verzik's third phase caused by occasionally appearing to target a dead player has been fixed.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 6 September 2018
|update = Making Friends With My Arm, Deadman Autumn Finals and Full Mobile Launch
|change = Elite clue drop rate was changed, as it was previously 1/750.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 21 June 2018
|update = Theatre of Blood Changes & Deadman Summer Finals
|change =
*Bosses' Hitpoints now scale to four and three player teams.
*Resource chests now use a point system instead of giving random supplies.
*The Nylocas encounter was shortened by removing some earlier waves as they made the encounter needlessly long. The boss of the encounter was also buffed by making damage dealt with the incorrect style reflect and heal 100% instead of 50%, as well as increasing its Hitpoints and damage dealt.
*Other minor tweaks were made regarding balance and QoL.
}}

*The release date for the Theatre of Blood was silently announced in [[Update:Bryophyta: The Moss Giant Boss|an update]] on [[3 May]] [[2018]] via a leaflet just north of the [[Ectofuntus]], which displayed the following message when read:
[[File:Theatre_of_Blood_leaflet_teaser.png|thumb|251px|The leaflet found north of the Ectofuntus.]]
{{Cquote2|Lady Verzik cordially invites you to the Theatre of Blood!<br/>The greatest collection of powerful beasts are here for your entertainment.

Tickets available from June 7th!}}
*The date was then changed to "Pentember 15th" after a player complaint of the leaflet not using the [[Calendar#Months_of_the_year|canonical in-game calendar]].
*Upon the release of the Theatre of Blood, there was a bug which would cause players to drop the item in the top right corner of their inventory on the floor upon death, if they were in possession of [[Dawnbringer]]. This bug was hotfixed within one hour of discovery.
